Articles.Content:
Jool-V challenge is one of the most participated challenges in the sub forum. I decided to give it a go as well.

So, what's so special about mine? Nothing really. Except that I used 1 lander to land on all the moons of Jool.

Here's my ship. The pic speaks for itself:

The design made it neccesary to first go to Tylo. Tylo requires the most dV to land and lift off from. After Tylo we went to Laythe. Because of the atmosphere it's easy to land on, but a bit harder to launch from. After that, Vall, Bop and Pol. All a lot easier, but with their own perticularities.

I made a few albums, which I will post in individual posts.

  • Launch
  • Transfer to Jool
  • Tylo
  • Laythe
  • Vall
  • Bop
  • Pol
  • Transfer to Kerbin and landing

Ready for blast off!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

That went flawless

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Tylo requires the most dV to land on and launch from. So we start there. 3 external tanks with extra engines provide the needed fuel and power to get it done.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This is where my first attempt stranded. I had by far not enough dV available to land AND return. The second attempt needed a rescue mission to provide the extra 100m/s dV to get back into orbit. This time, I added a small desposable stage to provide the needed chutes and extra fuel.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Vall is a dull snowball. Forgot to take a lot of screenshots.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Bop is a potato. Hardly any flat areas. Good thing I brought a lander with a wide footprint and a low center of gravity.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Pol is a haunted golf ball. Don't ever go there!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I had a little over 2000m/s dV left in the transfer stage, plus some more in the lander. I was confident returning to Kerbin would be a piece of cake.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Thanks for reading watching looking
